---
title: "Monocentric City Model II & Urban Sprawl"
---

## Overview

This lecture extends the basic monocentric city model to examine more complex urban phenomena, including the effects of income heterogeneity, land-use regulation, and the causes and consequences of urban sprawl.

## Key Topics

- Extensions of the monocentric model
  - Income sorting and neighborhood stratification
  - Multiple job centers (polycentric cities)
  - Open vs. closed city models

- Urban Sprawl
  - Definition and measurement
  - Causes: transportation costs, income, preferences, regulation
  - Consequences: environmental impacts, infrastructure costs
  - The role of zoning and land-use regulation

## Policy Questions

- What is the optimal city size?
- How should cities regulate land use?
- Costs and benefits of suburban development
